moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4: The Scotch Game - sacrificing a pawn for development and an attack on f7.  White can choose 4. Nxd4 to continue with the Scotch Game, 4. c3 for the Goring Gambit, or 4. Bc4, the Scotch Gambit
moves.3... exd4 4. Bc4: I like attacking so therefore I choose to play the Scotch Gambit, a dangerous opening if played incorrectly against
moves.4... Bc5: ...Bc5, one of the more common replies as it defends the pawn on d4.  4...Bb4  or transposing into the Guicco Piano with 4...Nf6 are also common
moves.5. c3: "sacrificing" a second pawn to open the d-file for the queen
moves.5... dxc3 6. Bxf7+: Bxf7.  Much more exciting than 6. Nxc3 and also prevents Black from castling.  Still in main line
moves.7... Ke8: ...Ke8.  Although it is an okay move, Kf8 seems to be a better choice.  In this game, it is a wasted move as the Black king goes to f8 anyway
moves.8. Qxc5 cxb2: ...cxb2.  Black elects to keep his pawn advantage, but gives my bishop a nice diagonal.  Bxg7 is now threatened
moves.9. Bxb2 d6: Driving away the White queen and opening lines for the light-squared bishop
moves.10. Qh5+: Qh5, keeping the queen in action on the kingside and opens up possibilities of a mating net on f7
moves.12. Qh4 Bd7: This move was a bit too passive for me.  12...Be6 seems fine and controls d5
moves.13. O-O: Finally getting my king to safety...now the attack can commence
moves.14... Kf7: ...Kf7?  Trying to get the king's rook into action, but a bad time to do it.  This move is the beginning of the end for my opponent as the Black king walks into my attack.
moves.15. e5: e5.  Forcing the win of material or an overwhelming position
moves.15... dxe5 16. Bxe5 Nxe5: ...Nxe5?  Better was Qd8; giving up the e-file but keeping the one pawn advantage
moves.17. Nxe5+: If ...Ke8, ...Kf8 or ...Kg8, then 18. Ng6 winning material
moves.17... Kg8 18. Ng6 Qd6: Choosing to keep the queens on the board
moves.19... Nd5 20. Ne7+: Ne7 .  Not Nxh8 as there is no point trading an active knight for a dead rook
moves.20... Kf8 21. Qxd5: Offering to trade queens for an easy endgame
moves.21... Qb4: ...Qb4??  Better was to trade queens and push the queenside pawns down White's throat.  This move walks into a forced mate.  Can you find the move?
moves.22. Qf3+:
Qf3 .  Black can go quietly or prolong the game as much as possible.
